source.name: _java._heap_size
source.label: Heap size
source.description: Specify the maximum Java Virtual Machine heap size in megabytes.

source.name: add_proccode_column
source.label: Add procedure return value to schema
source.description: Adds the ProcCode column which consists of the procedure return code to the schema.

source.name: before_after.after
source.label: After SQL
source.description: Enter the SQL statement to run once after all data is processed.

source.name: before_after.after.fail_on_error
source.label: Fail on error After SQL
source.description: Abort the job if there is an error executing a command

source.name: before_after.after_node
source.label: After SQL (node)
source.description: Enter the SQL statement to run once on each node after all data is processed on that node.

source.name: before_after.after_node.fail_on_error
source.label: Fail on error After SQL (node)
source.description: Abort the job if there is an error executing a command

source.name: before_after.before
source.label: Before SQL
source.description: Enter the SQL statement to run once before any data is processed.

source.name: before_after.before.fail_on_error
source.label: Fail on error Before SQL
source.description: Abort the job if there is an error executing a command

source.name: before_after.before_node
source.label: Before SQL (node)
source.description: Enter the SQL statement to run once on each node before any data is processed on that node.

source.name: before_after.before_node.fail_on_error
source.label: Fail on error Before SQL (node)
source.description: Abort the job if there is an error executing a command

source.name: byte_limit
source.label: Byte limit
source.description: The maximum number of bytes to return. Use any of following suffixes to change the unit: KB, MB, GB, or TB. A value of 0 returns all data.

source.name: call_statement
source.label: Call procedure statement
source.description: The SQL statement to execute the stored procedure

source.name: decimal_rounding_mode
source.label: Decimal Rounding Mode
source.description: Different rounding modes for values in columns of decimal and numeric data types

source.name: default_max_string_binary_precision
source.label: Default maximum length for columns
source.description: Default maximum length for columns. This property can be set/is applicable only when runtime column propagation is used

source.name: generate_unicode_columns
source.label: Generate unicode type columns
source.description: Generate unicode type columns. This property can be set/is applicable only when runtime column propagation is used

source.name: key_column_names
source.label: Key column names
source.description: A comma separated list of column names to override the primary key used for partitioning

source.name: procedure_name
source.label: Procedure name
source.description: The name of the stored procedure to be executed

source.name: push_filters
source.label: Push filters
source.description: Filters as Spark SQL to be pushed to the data source

source.name: pushed_filters
source.label: Pushed filters
source.description: Inferred property that returns filters as Spark SQL that were pushed to the data source

source.name: query_timeout
source.label: Query Timeout
source.description: Specify the Query Timeout. If not specified the default value of 600 seconds or 10 minutes will be used.

source.name: rcp
source.label: Infer schema
source.description: Obtain the schema from the data source

source.name: read_mode
source.label: Read method
source.description: The method for reading records from the table

source.name: rejected_filters
source.label: Rejected filters
source.description: Inferred property that returns filters as Spark SQL that could not be pushed to the data source and still need to be evaluated

source.name: row_limit
source.label: Row limit
source.description: The maximum number of rows to return

source.name: schema_name
source.label: Schema name
source.description: The name of the schema that contains the table to read from

source.name: select_statement
source.label: Select statement
source.description: The SQL SELECT statement for retrieving data from the table

source.name: table_name
source.label: Table name
source.description: The name of the table to read from

source.name: transform
source.label: Transform
source.description: Specifies if the transform capability is used

source.name: user_defined_function
source.label: User defined function
source.description: Specify if a user defined function is expected.

target.name: _java._heap_size
target.label: Heap size
target.description: Specify the maximum Java Virtual Machine heap size in megabytes.

target.name: batch_size
target.label: Batch size
target.description: Number of records to be included in each batch

target.name: before_after.after
target.label: After SQL
target.description: Enter the SQL statement to run once after all data is processed.

target.name: before_after.after.fail_on_error
target.label: Fail on error After SQL
target.description: Abort the job if there is an error executing a command

target.name: before_after.after_node
target.label: After SQL (node)
target.description: Enter the SQL statement to run once on each node after all data is processed on that node.

target.name: before_after.after_node.fail_on_error
target.label: Fail on error After SQL (node)
target.description: Abort the job if there is an error executing a command

target.name: before_after.before
target.label: Before SQL
target.description: Enter the SQL statement to run once before any data is processed.

target.name: before_after.before.fail_on_error
target.label: Fail on error Before SQL
target.description: Abort the job if there is an error executing a command

target.name: before_after.before_node
target.label: Before SQL (node)
target.description: Enter the SQL statement to run once on each node before any data is processed on that node.

target.name: before_after.before_node.fail_on_error
target.label: Fail on error Before SQL (node)
target.description: Abort the job if there is an error executing a command

target.name: call_each_row
target.label: Execute procedure for each row
target.description: Executes procedure for each row

target.name: call_statement
target.label: Call procedure statement
target.description: The SQL statement to execute the stored procedure

target.name: create_statement
target.label: Create statement
target.description: The Create DDL statement for recreating the target table

target.name: existing_table_action
target.label: Table action
target.description: The action to take on the target table, if it already exists, to handle the existing and new data sets

target.name: key_column_names
target.label: Key column names
target.description: A comma separated list of column names to override the primary key used during an update or merge

target.name: procedure_name
target.label: Stored procedure name
target.description: The name of the stored procedure to be executed

target.name: query_timeout
target.label: Query Timeout
target.description: Specify the Query Timeout. If not specified the default value of 600 seconds or 10 minutes will be used.

target.name: schema_name
target.label: Schema name
target.description: The name of the schema that contains the table to write to

target.name: static_statement
target.label: Static statement
target.description: The SQL used for setup operations, for example a CREATE statement

target.name: table_action
target.label: Table action
target.description: The action to take on the target table to handle the new data set

target.name: table_name
target.label: Table name
target.description: The name of the table to write to

target.name: update_statement
target.label: Update statement
target.description: The SQL INSERT, UPDATE, MERGE, or DELETE statement for updating data in the table.

target.name: write_mode
target.label: Write mode
target.description: The mode for writing records to the target table
